transcript:
As he rode up to the camp he thought how he would impress Borfs and all his comrades of the Guards by his appearance that of a fighting hussar who had been under fire. 
The Guards had made their whole march as if on a pleasure trip, parading their cleanli- ness and discipline. They had come by easy 
stages, their knapsacks conveyed on carts, and the Austrian authorities had provided excel- lent dinners for the officers at every halting place. The regiments had entered and left the town wit
